an4.26:1.1: “Mendicants, those mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds, insolent, and scattered: they are no mendicants of mine.
an4.26:1.2: They’ve left this teaching and training, and they don’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an4.26:1.3: But those mendicants who are genuine, not flatterers, wise, amenable, and serene: they are mendicants of mine.
an4.26:1.4: They haven’t left this teaching and training,
an4.26:1.5: and they achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
an4.26:2.1: Those who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, and frauds,
an4.26:2.3: these don’t grow in the teaching
an4.26:2.4: that was taught by the perfected Buddha.
an4.26:3.1: But those who are genuine, not flatterers, wise,
an4.26:3.3: these do grow in the teaching
an4.26:3.4: that was taught by the perfected Buddha.”
